scenes.label: *start
texts: ポロン
...So I knew exactly what was gonna happen, since it was my second time through.
After passing the pedestrian bridge with the graffiti, my graper was hacked, and we were thrown off of it.
Then that tatted baldy-builder beat the shit outta me.
Next, the chopper carrying the boy with the bow-tie took Momo away.
After that, I saw a screen in my BMI that I'd never before, and when I selected it, the world reset.
I already knew that the army would be made to retreat, and I knew when Oz would drive by too.
And everything went exactly as I remembered.
Momo had no recollection of being flung off the graper, or of being taken away by the chopper.
None of that that stuff has happened to this Momo.
モモ
モモ・着ぐるみ
モモ
モモ・着ぐるみ
Pollon, what could have triggered such a phenomenon is beyond me...
モモ
モモ・着ぐるみ
But I do believe it's possible.
ポロン
Why's that?
モモ
モモ・着ぐるみ
I myself had a similar experience earlier.
Seriously?
モモ
モモ・着ぐるみ
Although in my case, it was more like—how should I put it? I suddenly "saw" it.

scenes.label: *chk
texts: モモ
モモ・着ぐるみ
I guess you could call it...a vision.
ポロン
Are you talking about what happened at the park?
モモ
モモ・着ぐるみ
What...is this...? Why...am I...?
モモ
モモ・着ぐるみ
No... This isn't good...
モモ
モモ・着ぐるみ
We need to run! If we stay here any longer—
Momo was speaking like she sensed danger back there, before the army actually showed up.
モモ
モモ・着ぐるみ
I saw the two of us, surrounded by the soldiers...
モモ
モモ・着ぐるみ
And one of them punching you in the stomach, knocking you to the ground.
ポロン
All of that? In a split second?
モモ
モモ・着ぐるみ
Yes.
And that was exactly what happened...
It was different from what happened to me though, that was for sure.
ポロン
Some sort of precognition...? Has anything like that happened to you before?
モモ
モモ・着ぐるみ
Yes, a long time ago...but I saw many visions just today.
モモ
モモ・着ぐるみ
Do you remember how I said your face flashed in my mind before I met you? That was one of them.
モモ
モモ・着ぐるみ
One may consider this as a miracle...
ポロン
Hm?
A miracle, huh? Was she the type to seriously believe in them? Was I supposed to play along, or...
モモ
モモ・着ぐるみ
Saying nothing else, Momo fell silent, her face troubled.
Hmm... I had no idea what she was thinking, so I didn't know what to say.
ポロン
I figured maybe I should shut up too.
I still had to make sense of what happened to me.

scenes.label: *fakesave1
texts: So...
The thing I needed to figure out was that weird screen I saw before the world reset.
Was it a BMI app? If it was, I couldn't remember installing it at all.
...Thinking about it, I'd actually seen that screen before, in video games.
ポロン
Yeah, it's where you manage your save data—
ポロン
Whoa! There it is!
モモ
モモ・着ぐるみ
Yes?
ポロン
Oh! I-it's nothin'.
The same window appeared over my BMI.
Did it react to my voice?
If this was a save screen, were all of these things saved data?
This one didn't have a date, though. Was it corrupted or something?
It seemed kinda dangerous, so I decided not to touch it.
Oh!
Yeah, this really was a save screen.
My guess was right.
There had to be a load screen too, then. That was the one I'd seen at the airport.
How was I supposed to activate it...?
It seemed to react to my voice last time, but how could I bring it up in my head without saying anything?
Right...

scenes.label: *notload_A
texts: Load screen, come out!
Come out!
Come on!
Heeeyyy!
Ummm...?
Hellooo!
No good?
Do somethiiing.
Did I actually need to say it?
I wasn't getting any kind of response.
Show thyself, load screen!
Hey, load screen!
Activating load screen!
Please show the load screen. Pretty pleeease!

scenes.label: *select1
texts: ポロン
Whoa.
And there it was.
How did this work? Was it deciphering my brainwaves? Did BMI have a function like that?
If I loaded this data, would I go back in time like before?
ポロン
...Yeah right.
I felt stupid taking this shit seriously. I had to chill.
Time is a one-way street. It can't be turned back.
And even if it could, that sure as hell wasn't something a BMI app could pull off.
Then again...
...I could clearly remember going back in time. That was something that actually happened, no doubt about it.
And I was the only one aware it had happened.
Why was it just me?
If time really did move backward, then my own consciousness and memories should've been reset too.
I was aware the whole time, though. And I remembered everything.
The impact I felt when my graper crashed and I hit the road... The windblast from the chopper taking off... My powerlessness at the airport...
I vividly remembered every detail. It couldn't have been some illusion.
What was it, then?
Was I actually just seeing some VR shit right now? Did I dive into VR mode without even realizing?
That would explain why I'd seen the same thing twice.
When did it happen, though? How long had I been in VR?
Since Momo appeared? Since yesterday's party at Symphony?
Recent VR was so photorealistic that it was indistinguishable from reality.
When the hell did I dive, though?
Plus, there's no way someone could've forced me into VR mode while I was sleeping.
To prevent all kinds of accidents, modern VR systems were designed not to allow non-permitted dives.
Of course, hackers could have messed with those systems, and forced me to dive against my will.
But I couldn't imagine anyone going that far just to make me see all this.
ポロン
Were there any other ways to explain a phenomenon where you experience the same few hours multiple times?
Maybe there was something on the internet?
First, there was the good old <tips,24,time machine>.
Was it my graper? Was it way more advanced than I thought?
...No way.
Also, if I went back in time using a time machine, wouldn't there be two of me?
Besides time machines, there were also...<tips,25,parallel worlds>.
Well, I did relive the experience, and took different actions which led to a different outcome.
Did that mean there were multiple worlds that I'd somehow moved between?
But why did that happen? How did I do it?
Yeah, this was just as absurd as the time machine idea.
Then there was <tips,26,time leaping>.
It made sense to assume my consciousness was the only thing that had gone back in time, given the state my body and graper were in.
Would it really be safe to assume that, though?
There was a fundamental problem with all of these theories.
Why wasn't my consciousness rewound? Or my memories?
Was it because I was the one who used the load screen? Was that why I was the only one who went back, along with time itself?
But I'd heard consciousness was something people couldn't figure out. They had no clue where it came from, always asking "where is the self?"
But now we had an app that let you redo things in the past, while keeping your consciousness and memories intact?
And I just happened to be the one who used it?
ポロン
Hmm...
Trying to figure it out just confused me more. It didn't seem like I'd get answers anytime soon.
No matter how much I thought about it, I never got any further than guesswork.
ポロン
...For now, I'll just call this, "Saving and Loading."
Only one thing that was clear to me.
That my BMI had been hacked by someone.
And this person had given me access to some weird app with access to the supernatural—or at least something like it.
ポロン
Tryin' to mess with me, huh?
I tried checking the BMI connection logs.
I hadn't done much of a deep dive, but I couldn't see any signs someone had messed with it.
My BMI had some tight security, and I'd installed some protection patches that were solid by my calculations.
Did the hacker really bypass all that and break in?
They'd need insane skill to pull that off. You'd need to be like...wizard-tier. Was I dealing with one of the greatest hackers of my generation?
Had I ever done anything to get someone like that on my ass?
A chill went down my spine as frustration began to well up within me.
Some hacker had done all this to me, and I couldn't even trace them back.
ポロン
...Dammit, pisses me off.
When?
When was this function added to my BMI?

scenes.label: *kaisou_2
texts: I looked back on all that had happened in the past few hours.
The events of the day had been wild, but...

scenes.label: *fakesave2
texts: ポロン
Nothin' really stands out...
I had to get back to figuring this thing out.

scenes.label: *polonsave2
texts: ...Could I Save my own data in the empty areas?
ポロン
Did I just Save, like, "now?"
ポロン
...Seriously?
Did it really create a save of the entire world just now?
Damn, how much space would that file need?
If I tried Loading the Saved data now, I'd find out whether I could use this "Save and Load" feature myself.
Part of me was tempted to try it.
Was this a good idea...?
ポロン
ポロン
Loa—
モモ
モモ・着ぐるみ
Ah.
ポロン
Huh?
ポロン
Umm...
モモ
モモ・着ぐるみ
Hahah... I guess I'm hungry. How about you?
ポロン
Yeah...me too.
If her stomach hadn't rumbled, I might've actually tried to Load.
As far as I knew though, it could still be a trap...so it was probably a good thing I didn't.
I decided to postpone the test.
I looked at the time and realized that almost an hour had passed since we started our little break.
I was getting kinda hungry myself.
ポロン
Let's get going.
I got up and told Momo to do the same.
